notes: Test task for priority feature

title: Review deps/blocks/graph behavior
description: Current behavior is confusing - subtasks don't display intuitively in graph. Determine reasonable behavior for parent/child task relationships and how they should render in graph output.
notes:
Starting review of deps/blocks/graph behavior
Fixed graph to render blocks relationships. However, identified that having both deps and blocks is confusing - they're redundant. Created tl-6d58a6ca to remove blocks.

title: Blocker task
notes:
Test using --blocks
Test task

title: Remove blocks, keep only deps
description: Simplify relationship model by removing blocks. Having both deps and blocks is redundant - they express the same ordering constraint from opposite directions. Keeping only deps is simpler and matches most task systems.
notes:
Starting implementation
Removed blocks from: types.go (Event, Task), state.go (ComputeState, GetReadyTasks, BuildDependencyGraph), commands.go (CmdCreate, CmdShow, CmdBlock, FormatDependencyTree), main.go (create flags, block command), and tests.

title: Research how to implement tlog compact command to perform log compaction
Add tlog compact command
notes:
Rewrite .tlog/events/* to single snapshot of current state. One create event per live task. Optional archive of old events.
YAGNI - repo is new, event log is tiny. Revisit when history becomes a problem.

title: Add batch task creation command
notes:
Allow creating multiple interconnected tasks in a single command with symbolic references that resolve to real IDs. JSON input format. LOW PRIORITY - needs quorum from multiple agents on value vs. bash chaining workaround.
Premature - no demonstrated need, bash chaining workaround exists, violates Unix philosophy

title: Update update command: description overwrites, notes appends
notes:
Key change: --notes should append to existing notes (with timestamp?), --description should overwrite. May need to load current state before appending.
Update command: --description overwrites, --notes appends

title: Invert graph command to show goal decomposition (root=goal, leaves=ready tasks)
description: Change graph visualization so parent goals are at root, subtasks/dependencies are children. Leaves should match what 'ready' returns.
notes:
Research current implementation first. Decompose into subtasks if the change is non-trivial.
Inverted graph: roots are now top-level goals (tasks nothing depends on), children are dependencies/subtasks. Leaves match ready tasks.

title: Add --label flag to list command for filtering
description: Filter tasks by label without parsing JSON
notes: Something like 'tlog list --label priority:high' to find tasks by label directly.

title: Update dep command to use --needs flag with multiple tasks
description: Change dep syntax from 'tlog dep A B' to 'tlog dep A --needs B [C D ...]'. Eliminates argument order ambiguity and supports adding multiple dependencies at once.
notes:
Example: tlog dep tl-abc123 --needs tl-def456 tl-ghi789
Implemented --needs and --remove flags. Supports comma-separated IDs or repeated flags.

title: remove 'tl-' prefix from tasks.  it provides no information and adds 3 characters repeatedly to output and log
notes: Removed tl- prefix from new task IDs. New IDs are 8-character hex strings.

title: Implement state computation
notes: compute_state() - replay events to build task map, get_ready_tasks() - filter open tasks with satisfied deps and no blockers

title: Support --status in_progress in list command
description: Allow filtering to see actively claimed tasks
notes: Currently list accepts open|done|all but not in_progress. Useful for seeing what work is underway.

title: Fix version display showing v0.0.2 when only v0.0.1 tag exists
description: go install shows pseudo-version v0.0.2-0.20260115185144-32db4baba86b instead of reflecting actual tag
notes: debug.ReadBuildInfo() returns Go pseudo-version which auto-increments patch. Need to investigate options: use git describe, hardcode version, or accept Go's behavior.

title: Add tlog labels command
notes:
Show all labels in use + recommended conventions. Helps agents discover existing taxonomy before creating tasks.

Recommended labels:
- priority:backlog|low|medium|high|critical
- type:feature|bug|refactor|chore
- needs:review|discussion|design|human

Freeform feature:<name> for grouping (not enumerated).
Show all labels in use + recommended conventions. Helps agents discover existing taxonomy before creating tasks.

Recommended labels:
- priority:backlog|low|medium|high|critical
- type:feature|bug|refactor|chore
- needs:human-review|agent-review|discussion|design

Freeform feature:<name> for grouping (not enumerated).

Philosophy: lightweight markers only. No workflow features. Unix-y - do one thing well.
Implemented: tlog labels shows in_use labels and recommended conventions

title: Add unclaim command to release tasks back to open
description: Allow agents to release a claimed task without marking done
notes:
If an agent claims a task and hits a blocker, they should be able to release it back to open. Using reopen feels semantically wrong since the task was never done.
Testing the feature

title: Add tlog claim command for in_progress status
notes:
New status: in_progress (open → in_progress → done)

Commands:
- tlog claim <id> [--note]: marks task as in_progress
- tlog unclaim <id>: reverts to open (or reuse reopen)

Behavior changes:
- tlog ready: excludes in_progress tasks
- tlog list --status in_progress: shows claimed work
- tlog done: works from in_progress state

No agent identity tracking - just status change.
Implementing claim command
Implemented claim command with in_progress status

title: Fix lint issues
description: Fix 9 lint issues found by golangci-lint: 5 errcheck (unchecked error returns in storage.go, tlog_test.go), 4 staticcheck (use tagged switch in commands.go, state.go)
notes: Fixed all 9 lint issues: 5 errcheck (added explicit error ignoring with _ =), 4 staticcheck (converted if-else chains to switch statements)

title: Convert justfile to Makefile and update documentation
Add --for flag to create command
description: Add --for PARENT flag that automatically adds the new task as a dependency of PARENT. Supports the decomposition workflow: create subtasks for a goal without a separate dep call.
notes:
Example: tlog create "Parse output" --for tl-abc123 creates a new task and makes it a dependency of tl-abc123.
Implemented --for flag. Creates task and adds it as dependency of parent in one operation.

title: Define description/notes field semantics
notes:
Design decisions: description overwrite semantics, notes append semantics, handling of existing tasks (migration?), CLI flags naming.
Semantics: description overwrites, notes appends (newline separated)

title: Fix tlog sync -m flag to use custom commit message
notes:
Currently tlog sync -m 'message' ignores the message and uses default 'tlog: sync tasks'. Should pass the message to git commit.
Fixed: main.go now accepts both -m and --message flags for sync command
